New Records: Tyler Herro led the Heat with 23 points, seven rebounds, and five assists, shooting 7-of-17 and 4-of-10 from the three-point range.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. scored a season-high 20 points, including a critical three-pointer to tie a season-high in three-pointers made in a single game.
Lauri Markkanen and Collin Sexton each scored 23 points for the Jazz.
Key Match Events: The Heat won the game 97-92, a close contest after a recent 36-point loss to the Jazz.
Jaquez's three-pointer was a turning point with 1:03 left in the game.
Both teams struggled from the three-point line, with the Heat shooting 25.7% and the Jazz at 30.6%.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat's win moved them to 19-17, while the Jazz dropped to 9-27.
The game was notable as the Heat's second game after a 36-point loss to the same opponent.
Young players like Jaquez and Jovic have been performing well in Jimmy Butler's absence.
The Jazz's poor performance was affected by the absence of several key players.
Others: The Heat are on a six-game road trip and need to strengthen their roster with a center and a point guard.
